election_record.label: New York 1814 State Senate, Eastern District

overview.note: Solomon Southwick was publisher of The Albany Register (Albany, NY). He was a Republican, but had fallen out of favor with the party in 1812, due to his support of DeWitt Clinton's candidacy for President. He ran for Senate as a Federalist, but many Federalists refused to vote for him. Had an established Federalist run instead of Solomon Southwick, it is probable that the party would have elected both Senators from the Eastern District.
The Albany Register (Albany, NY) refers to the Federalist candidates as the New York Ticket, and to the Republican ticket as the Virginia Ticket.

William Patrick, Jr., Epenetus White, Jr., John M. Berry, Samuel Bailey, Isaac Sargent, Nathaniel Pitcher, John Gale, Henry Matison, John Richards, Samuel Young, Richard Ketcham, Howel Gardner, Reuben Sanford, Levi Thompson and Benjamin Cowles were candidates for Assembly. Benjamin Pond and John Savage were were candidates for U.S. House of Representatives.

sub_unit.name: Albany
sub_unit.note: The Albany Argus (Albany, NY), The Albany Register (Albany, NY), National Advocate (New York, NY), Northern Budget (Troy, NY), and The Columbian (New York, NY), May 2, report 1426 votes for George Tibbits in Albany County.

sub_unit.name: Bethlehem
sub_unit.note: The Albany Argus (Albany, NY), The Albany Register (Albany, NY), National Advocate (New York, NY), and The Columbian (New York, NY), May 2, report 222 votes for George Tibbits in Bethlehem.

sub_unit.name: Watervliet
sub_unit.note: John Woodworth received 1 vote as John Woodwor.

sub_unit.name: Peru
sub_unit.note: The Plattsburgh Republican (Plattsburgh, NY) reports 60 votes for the Federalist ticket in Peru.

sub_unit.name: Plattsburg
sub_unit.note: The Plattsburgh Republican (Plattsburgh, NY) reports 145 votes for the Republican ticket and 78 votes for the Federalist ticket in Plattsburgh.

sub_unit.name: Essex
sub_unit.note: The Albany Argus (Albany, NY), May 20, and National Advocate (New York, NY), May 23: "Essex. -- Extract of a letter to the editor. 'The republican majorities in this county are as follows: ... Sen. -- Woodworth over Southwick, 1008, Van Schoonhoven over Tibbits, 85 ."

sub_unit.name: Montgomery
sub_unit.note: John Woodworth received 71 votes as John Woodwood.

The Cabinet (Schenectady, NY), The Columbian (New York, NY), May 31, and The Columbian. (For the Country) (New York, NY), June 1, report 1719 votes for George Tibbits; however, the sum of totals per town in is 1749.

The Cabinet (Schenectady, NY), The Columbian (New York, NY), May 31, The Columbian. (For the Country) (New York, NY), June 1, and The Albany Argus (Albany, NY), May 10, report 1783 votes for Guert Van Schoonhoven. The sum of totals per town in The Cabinet (Schenectady, NY) is 1779. The sum of totals per town in The Columbian (New York, NY), May 31, The Columbian. (For the Country) (New York, NY), June 1, is 1786.
The Cabinet (Schenectady, NY) reports 1613 votes for Solomon Southwick; however, the sum of totals per town in is 1618.

sub_unit.name: Johnstown
sub_unit.note: The Columbian (New York, NY), May 31, and The Columbian. (For the Country) (New York, NY), June 1, report 288 votes for Guert Van Schoonhoven in Johnstown.

sub_unit.name: Northampton
sub_unit.note: The Columbian (New York, NY), May 31, and The Columbian. (For the Country) (New York, NY), June 1, report 65 votes for Guert Van Schoonhoven in Northampton.

sub_unit.name: Stratford
sub_unit.note: The Cabinet (Schenectady, NY) reports 18 votes for Solomon Southwick in Stratford.

sub_unit.name: Rensselaer
sub_unit.note: John Woodworth received 1 vote as John Wood Woodworth.
Solomon Southwick receievd 1 vote as S. Southwick.
The Columbian (New York, NY), May 9, and Lansingburgh Gazette report 1256 votes for Guert Van Schoonhoven in Rensselaer County; however, the sum of totals per town is 1257.

sub_unit.name: Berlin
sub_unit.note: Northern Budget (Troy, NY) reports 119 votes for Solomon Southwick in Berlin.

sub_unit.name: Grafton
sub_unit.note: Lansingburgh Gazette, Troy Post (Troy, NY), The Columbian (New York, NY), May 31, and The Columbian. (For the Country) (New York, NY), June 1, report 56 votes for Guert Van Schoonhoven in Grafton.

sub_unit.name: Nassau
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY) reports 184 votes for George Tibbits, 59 votes for John Woodworth, and 185 votes for Solomon Southwick in Nassau.

sub_unit.name: Petersburgh
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY) reports 77 votes for George Tibbits and 79 votes for Solomon Southwick in Petersburgh.

sub_unit.name: Sandlake
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY) reports 92 votes for Guert Van Schoonhoven and 93 votes for John Woodworth in Sandlake.

sub_unit.name: Milton
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY), May 6, reports 137 votes for Guert Van Schoonhoven and 130 votes for John Woodworth in Milton.

sub_unit.name: Warren
sub_unit.note: Guert Van Schoonhoven received 1 vote as Garret Van Schoonhoven.

The Columbian. (For the Country) (New York, NY), June 1, and Northern Budget (Troy, NY) report a total of 1963 votes for Guert Van Schoonhoven in Warren and Washington Counties; however, the sum of totals per town is 1973.

sub_unit.name: Cambridge
sub_unit.note: In a probable typographcial error, The Columbian. (For the Country) (New York, NY), June 1, reports 273 votes for Solomon Southwick in Cambridge.

election_record.reference: The Columbian. (For the Country) (New York, NY). May 11, 1814.
The Columbian. (For the Country) (New York, NY). June 1, 1814.
